Benefits of Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship (SGS)

  • Health insurance for non-EU and non-EFTA students
  • One-year half-fare public transportation card
  • Monthly stipend of CHF 1920
  • Support for various trips, dinners, and sightseeing tours
  • Special CHE 300 housing allowance (paid once at the beginning)
  • For non-EU students, a flight payment for a ticket back to their home country
  • All other benefits are the same as to mention above for Ph.D.
  • Monthly stipend of CHF 3500

Documents necessary for Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships (SGS)

Applicants are to require submitting 2 sets of application documents (1 original + 1 copy):

  • 1st set of credentials contains the original, signed documents plus the letters of recommendation
  • 2nd set of credentials is a copy of the 1st set except for the letters of approval
  • Two copies of the applicant’s passport (major page with personal data)
  • Medical certificate
  • Copies of certificates and transcripts from previously attended Colleges.
  • Confidential letters of recommendation
  • Applicants for the doctoral program; admission letter from the doctoral school
  • Letter from an academic host professor (including his/her CV)
  • CV with a listing of educational publications
  • FCS application form with a photo.

Eligibility| SGS Scholarship

Applicants that do not meet all the criteria of SGS will be not be admitted.

  • All doctoral applicants must also provide an admission letter from the doctoral school in addition to the supporting invitation.
  • Applicants must provide a support letter from an academic professor at the chosen Swiss university confirming why she/he agrees to supervise and support the Ph.D. thesis.
  • D. Applicant’s date of birth must be after December 31, 1984.

Deadlines |SGS Scholarship
